marklogic.body:
I've been making this recipe for years and everyone loves it.
2 sticks of softened unsalted butter(If hard just pop the butter in the microwave for 15 odd seconds)
3/4 cup cocoa powder(unsweetened)
6 eggs
1 tablespoon vanilla extract
2 cups sugar(I like to use a cup and a half and taste the batter then add some more if required)
1 1/2 cup + a tablespoon of all purpose flour
1 tsp salt
One large handful of nuts of your choice(I used a mixture of hazelnuts,cashews and almonds)
Roughly chop the nuts..you want sizable chunks, keep aside.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit
In a bowl beat the eggs with the sugar and vanilla
In another bowl measure out the flour and salt
Melt the butter in a saucepan on the stove(on medium Heat) stir in the chocolate and mix well, then take it the stove
I take it the stove prior to adding the eggs and sugar mixture because if the chocolate mixture is Too hot it wills scramble the eggs and somehow chocolate scrambled eggs don't sound very appealing.
After taking the saucepan Off the Heat, let it cool for a few minutes
Armed with a whisk, throw in the egg,sugar and vanilla mixture and whisk violently until the eggs are fully incorporated, taste it to see if the sugar is ok (and no you are not going to die of salmonella)
Next add in the flour and nuts and mix well
Pour batter in pan of your choice.
Bake for 15 odd minutes if you're using cupcake trays,23-25 minutes if using a cake pan. Personally I like to shove a skewer through the middle of the cake and check if it comes out clean, if it does, your cake's ready. Let it cool completely before taking it out the pan
I like to make it in cupcake tins, comes out easily just grease the tins well
